glluch.com.ontotaxoseeker

Class TaxoPath

  • java.lang.Object
    • glluch.com.ontotaxoseeker.TaxoPath

  • public class TaxoPath
extends Object
    Do several actions on Path related to IEEE computers ontology.
    Author:
    Guillem LLuch Moll

        public PathsCount findPaths(String doc)
                     throws IOException
        Search for all the paths in a txt document.
        Parameters:
        doc - The txt to be processed
        Returns:
        A list of paths and its ocurrences-
        Throws:
        IOException - Reading files.

      • nouns

        protected com.glluch.findterms.TermsCount nouns(String doc)
                                         throws IOException
        Given a text search for nouns and return it
        Parameters:
        doc - The text source.
        Returns:
        A list of nouns in doc and their counts.
        Throws:
        IOException - Reading a file in freeling.

      • findPaths

        public PathsCount findPaths(com.glluch.findterms.TermsCount terms)
                     throws IOException
        Given a list of terms (with counts) builds a list of path, with counts. So, transforms each term into null if it isn't in the taxonomy or in its path if it is in.
        Parameters:
        terms - The list of terms and its counts.
        Returns:
        A list of paths from the taxonomy and its counts.
        Throws:
        IOException - Reading a file in freeling.

      • showPaths

        public void showPaths(PathsCount termsPaths)
        Print in console the paths in friendly way.
        Parameters:
        termsPaths - The list of term and its counts.

      • prettyPrintPaths

        public String prettyPrintPaths(PathsCount termsPaths)
        Creates a String ready for print.
        Parameters:
        termsPaths - The list of term and its counts.
        Returns:
        An String with a line per path and its ocurrences.

      • path

        public Path path(String termUri)
          throws IOException
        Given a candite URI, search in the taxonomy and return its path, if the uri corresponds a term in the ontology or null otherwise.
        Parameters:
        termUri - The candidate URI, for example http://glluch.com/ieee_taxonomy#routing .
        Returns:
        The path of the uri o null if the uri is missing. For example, /communications_technology/communication_systems/routing
        Throws:
        IOException - Reading files.

      • up

        public org.apache.jena.rdf.model.Statement up(String termUri)
                                       throws IOException
        Given a URI returns its immediate parent if exisists, null otherwise.
        Parameters:
        termUri - The URI for which the parent will be searched.
        Returns:
        An Apache Jena statement which corresponds to the parent.
        Throws:
        IOException - Reading the ontology file.
